div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 271 Agrinion, Aetolia, 1959 Burial: c. 145-135 B.C. (T)* Contents: 1348 AR Aenianes: 2 triob. Lamia: 4 triob. Oetaei: 1 triob. Thessalian League: 1 triob. Aetolia: 97 triob. Locri Opuntii: 17 triob. Phocis: 1 triob. Boeotia: 11 triob.; 4 dr. Chalcis: 72 dr. Histiaea: 6 dr. Athens: 39 tetradr. Aegina: 1 dr. Achaean League: 838 triob. Sicyon: 50 triob. Messene: 2 triob. Argos: 10 triob. Megalopolis: 151 triob. Cyme: 2 tetradr. Roman Rep.: 39 den. Disposition: New York (except 1 Cyme, 3 Chalcis, 4 Achaean League) Losada, Phoenix 19 (1965), pp. 129-33 (Athens) Hersh, NC 1966, pp. 71-93 (denarii) Dengate, ANSMN 13 (1967), pp. 57–110 (Mega- lopolis) † Thompson, NNM 159 (1968), illus. Warren, ANSMN 15 (1969), pp. 31-40 (Mega- lopolis) * The Greek material suggests a burial date between 150-140 B.C.; the denarii would lower that date to c. 135 B.C. or slightly later according to Thomsen- Crawford (see appendix to NNM 159). Hersh argues for an earlier date for the Roman coins, c. 140 B.C.
